description: Returns information about a job template.

parameters.name: jobTemplateId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the job template.

nested_items.name: jobTemplateArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the job template.

nested_items.name: jobTemplateId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the job template.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the job template.

nested_items.name: documentSource
nested_items.description: An S3 link to the job document.

nested_items.name: document
nested_items.description: The job document.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job template was created.

nested_items.name: presignedUrlConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.

nested_items.name: expiresInSec
nested_items.description: How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.

nested_items.name: jobExecutionsRolloutConfig
nested_items.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

nested_items.name: maximumPerMinute
nested_items.description: The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.

nested_items.name: exponentialRate
nested_items.description: The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an exponential rate for a job rollout.

nested_items.name: baseRatePerMinute
nested_items.description: The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: incrementFactor
nested_items.description: The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.

nested_items.name: rateIncreaseCriteria
nested_items.description: The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

nested_items.name: numberOfNotifiedThings
nested_items.description: The threshold for number of notified things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: numberOfSucceededThings
nested_items.description: The threshold for number of succeeded things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: abortConfig
nested_items.description: The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.

nested_items.name: criteriaList
nested_items.description: The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.

nested_items.name: failureType
nested_items.description: The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.

nested_items.name: action
nested_items.description: The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.

nested_items.name: thresholdPercentage
nested_items.description: The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.

nested_items.name: minNumberOfExecutedThings
nested_items.description: The minimum number of things which must receive job execution notifications before the job can be aborted.

nested_items.name: timeoutConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

nested_items.name: inProgressTimeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal TIMED_OUT status.

nested_items.name: jobExecutionsRetryConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration that determines how many retries are allowed for each failure type for a job.

nested_items.name: criteriaList
nested_items.description: The list of criteria that determines how many retries are allowed for each failure type for a job.

nested_items.name: failureType
nested_items.description: The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job retry.

nested_items.name: numberOfRetries
nested_items.description: The number of retries allowed for a failure type for the job.

nested_items.name: maintenanceWindows
nested_items.description: Allows you to configure an optional maintenance window for the rollout of a job document to all devices in the target group for a job.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: Displays the start time of the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: durationInMinutes
nested_items.description: Displays the duration of the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: destinationPackageVersions
nested_items.description: The package version Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that are installed on the device when the job successfully completes. The package version must be in either the Published or Deprecated state when the job deploys. For more information, see Package version lifecycle.
(string) ---
